xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class DistributionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.DistributionUtils

  • public class DistributionUtils
extends Object
    Utility class to namespace static methods that handle marshalling, unmarshalling, and long references. In most cases, this consists of determining what class is supposed to perform the operation, and delegating to it. This class thus serves as a public entry point to otherwise package-private operations like long reference creation, and to make it possible to perform generic objects like marshalling on objects without needing to know the precise form that that marshalling will take.
    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Method Detail

      • isStoredRemotely

        public static boolean isStoredRemotely(Object ref)
        Returns whether the data for the given reference is currently stored remotely. In other words, whether ref is currently acting as a long reference.

        The difference between this and instanceof LongReference is as follows: LongReference means that the data could potentially be stored remotely, and will not change over the lifetime of the reference even if the place where the data stores is actually changed; isStoredRemotely means that the data is definitely stored remotely right now (or with a return of false, isn't), but doesn't make guarantees about the location of the data in the future (it can change over time, including in a racy way before your code has a chance to read the return value of this method).

        Parameters:
        ref - The reference to check.
        Returns:
        true if the data is stored only on another virtual machine; false if the data is stored on this virtual machine (potentially in addition to others) or if ref is null

      • makeLongReference

        public static <T> T makeLongReference(T referent)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Produces a long reference to a given object. Only works on objects to which long references would naturally be formed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The declared type of the object to create a long reference to.
        Parameters:
        referent - The object to create a long reference to.
        Returns:
        A long reference to the object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the object is not of a class that is marshalled via long references

      • describe

        public static ObjectDescription describe(Object obj)
        Create a description of the given object, not including the class it belongs to. (Note that this is a shallow copy, not a reference copy, i.e. even if the object would normally be described as a single reference, it'll be described to depth 1.)
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to describe.
        Returns:
        A description of that object.

      • describeField

        public static ObjectDescription describeField(Object obj,
                                              Class<?> declaredType)
        Create a description of a hypothetical field containing the given object, including its class. (This will have identical semantics to a reference copy of the object, and may well actually simply be a reference copy of the object, although it will be a shallow copy in cases where the object is Copiable.) The description will be read-only, and its read pointer will be rewound to the start.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to describe.
        declaredType - The declared type of the hypothetical field in question. Can be null if no such field actually exists. This information must be available when reproducing the description.
        Returns:
        A description of the object.

      • readClassAndObject

        public static Object readClassAndObject(ReadableDescription description,
                                        Object parent,
                                        Class<?> expected)
                                 throws IOException
        Reads a class name description from the copiable portion of a description, then reads an object of that class from that description. The way in which the object is read will depend on the class name that is read.

        TODO: This shouldn't be public, but is currently needed to be public for testing purposes.

        Parameters:
        description - The description to read from.
        parent - The object that will contain the object being read; used to resolve self-references.
        expected - The class which was expected, when marshalling this object, to be the most likely class that the unmarshal process would believe the object to have. This is normally the declared type of the field in which the resulting object will be stored.
        Returns:
        The object that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If corruption of the description is detected (note that not all corruption can be detected)
